title: Genesis Chapter 32 Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of Genesis chapter 32 with 16 questions covering key people, places, events, and teachings from this chapter.

questions.question: What did the Lord do in Genesis 32:4?
options: Built an altar to the Lord
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:4 states: "And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned ..."

questions.question: What did Esau do in Genesis 32:17?

questions.question: What did Esau do in Genesis 32:19?
options: Led the people through the wilderness
Built an altar to the Lord
Commanded he the second, and the third
questions.correctAnswer: Commanded he the second, and the third
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:19 states: "And so commanded he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall ye spea..."

questions.question: What did Jacob do in Genesis 32:29?
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:29 states: "And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after ..."

questions.question: According to Genesis 32:1, who went on his way?
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:1 states: "And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him."

questions.question: According to Genesis 32:7, who was greatly afraid and distressed?

questions.question: Who said "O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD which saidst..." in Genesis 32:9?
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:9 states: "And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD which saidst unto me, Return unto th..."

questions.question: According to Genesis 32:24, who was left alone?
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:24 states: "And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day."

questions.question: Who said "Tell me, I pray thee, thy name" in Genesis 32:29?
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:29 states: "And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after ..."

questions.question: According to Genesis 32:30, who called the name of the place Peniel?
questions.explanation: Genesis 32:30 states: "And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved."

questions.question: What location is mentioned in Genesis 32:10?

questions.question: In Genesis 32:3, Israel was sent forth.
questions.explanation: This is false. It was Jacob, not Israel, who was sent forth. Genesis 32:3 states: "And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the country of Edom."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 32:2: "And when ______ saw them, he said, This is God's host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God's host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 32:5: "And I have ______, and asses, flocks, and menservants, and womenservants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and menservants, and womenservants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may f..."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 32:6: "And the messengers returned to ______, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he cometh to meet thee, and four hundred men with him."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he cometh to meet thee, and four ..."

questions.question: Complete this verse from Genesis 32:8: "And said, If ______ come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left shall escape."
questions.explanation: The complete verse reads: "And said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left shall escape."
